page.title: 01THE TOWN OF SHEFFORD
page.content: Situated in the flat lands of Mid- Bedfordshire,Shefford is a small market town of some Three and a Half THousand population.It was first granted a market charter in 1225 and although never achieving any notable status has continued to servethe surrounding agricultural comunity throughout the centuries.Although the Town as such did not exist at the time of the Domesday Book it is known that there were two Roman settlements within the present bondaries,possibly established during the 3rd and 4th centuries. The name is derived from the Anglo saxon Schipford or Sepford "Sheep Ford" which indicates that here was an easy crossing point through the two small rivers Hit(or Cambel) and Flitt.
